metadata.name: Ciclopirox 3 Itraconazole 5 Urea 20 154 66 mg Capsule coated

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of the following fungal infections in immunocompromised and non immunocompromised patients pulmonary and extrapulmonary blastomycosis histoplasmosis aspergillosis and onychomycosis

contraindications.disease: No significant lethality was observed when itraconazole was administered orally to mice and rats at dosage levels of 320 mg kg or to dogs at 200 mg kg
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Itraconazole is an imidazole triazole type antifungal agent Itraconazole is a highly selective inhibitor of fungal cytochrome P 450 sterol C 14 alpha demethylation via the inhibition of the enzyme cytochrome P450 14 alpha demethylase This enzyme converts lanosterol to ergosterol and is required in fungal cell wall synthesis The subsequent loss of normal sterols correlates with the accumulation of 14 alpha methyl sterols in fungi and may be partly responsible for the fungistatic activity of fluconazole Mammalian cell demethylation is much less sensitive to fluconazole inhibition Itraconazole exhibits i in vitro i activity against i Cryptococcus neoformans i and i Candida spp i Fungistatic activity has also been demonstrated in normal and immunocompromised animal models for systemic and intracranial fungal infections due to i Cryptococcus neoformans i and for systemic infections due to i Candida albicans i
